definition: to take possession of/to occupy/to take up
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc

sentences.english: After the Russo-Japanese War, Japan's occupation of southern Sakhalin in Russia.
sentences.chinese: 日俄战争后，日本占领俄国库页岛南部。
1759年的今天，英国占领魁北克城。

sentences.english: Shi Xing pain Chen interests, points out the consequences of the Japanese occupation of Korea will bring.
sentences.chinese: 石星痛陈利害，指出了日军占领朝鲜会带来的恶果。

sentences.english: The coastal desert occupies a long strip between the Pacific Ocean and the Andes Mountains.
sentences.chinese: 海岸荒漠占领长条状的之间的太平洋和安第斯山脉。

sentences.english: In 638 the Moslems had captured Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 公元638年穆斯林人占领了耶路撒冷。

sentences.english: The occupiers immediately froze wages and made strikes illegal .
sentences.chinese: 占领军立即宣布冻结工资并规定罢工为非法。

sentences.english: The black sesame market is taken by the comparatively safe Myanmar sesame.
sentences.chinese: 黑芝麻市场被相对安全的缅甸芝麻所占领。

sentences.english: A city that parleys is half gotten.
sentences.chinese: 与敌人谈判的城市，等于一半被占领。

sentences.english: Large parts of Britain were under Roman occupation.
sentences.chinese: 不列颠的大部分领土曾被罗马人占领。

sentences.english: Commando force joined up with the airborne troops near the captured bridge.
sentences.chinese: 突击队和空降部队在被占领的桥梁附近汇合。

sentences.english: 1944 - World War II: Nazi forces occupy Hungary.
sentences.chinese: 1944年的今天，二战中纳粹军队占领了匈牙利。

sentences.english: By the end of1939, the whole of the north-eastern quarter of China was under Japanese occupation.
sentences.chinese: 到1939年底，中国整个东北地区都被日军占领。

sentences.english: Crashing sesame market is taken by African sesame, which has price advantage.
sentences.chinese: 榨油芝麻被非洲的具有价格优势的芝麻占领。

sentences.english: Carl Meier was stationed in the family's neighborhood during the German occupation.
sentences.chinese: 在德军占领期，卡尔迈耶住在母亲家隔壁。

sentences.english: There are small islands that China has seized from Vietnam in during the Vietnam War.
sentences.chinese: 越战期间中国曾占领了越南一些小岛屿。

sentences.english: Hancheng pepper occupied the domestic market, it is also exported to Southeast Asia.
sentences.chinese: 韩城花椒占领国内市场的同时，还出口东南亚。

definition: to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
to overcome/to take (a fortress)/to fall (to an attack)/to surrender
to fall into enemy hands/to be occupied/to degenerate/to submerge
stronghold/defended military base/base for operations/strategic point/foothold/(market) presence
to take back (forcibly)/to recapture/to win back
to withdraw/to leave/to retreat/to pull out
